comments:
After I'm done with an OleControlSite, I setParent() to a "non visisble holding composite", and then I dispose() its parent, which is an OleFrame.  The next time I need an OleControlSite, I take a previous one, create a new OleFrame, and then set the parent to the new OleFrame.  That works on the UI.. until a focusIn event is received by OleControlSite.  COMObject seems to look up the old (original) OleFrame and sends it setMenu().  That results in the "widget is disposed" error.   In case you're wondering why I'm attemting to re-use OleControlSites, it's because we instantiate and dispose tons of them in our app, and there is a very significant handle / memory leak because of that.

Stack Trace:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3374)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3268)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:432)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:327)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.getShell(Control.java:1101)
	at org.eclipse.swt.ole.win32.OleFrame.SetMenu(OleFrame.java:695)
	at org.eclipse.swt.ole.win32.OleFrame.access$9(OleFrame.java:690)
	at org.eclipse.swt.ole.win32.OleFrame$5.method10(OleFrame.java:300)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.ole.win32.COMObject.callback10(COMObject.java:153)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.DispatchMessageW(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.DispatchMessage(OS.java:1922)

	at ReParentOleBrowser.run(ReParentOleBrowser.java:175)
	at ReParentOleBrowser.main(ReParentOleBrowser.java:50)

I have a sample program if you need it.

I'm using the latest SWT I could find..  swt-win32-3230.dll with a corresponding swt.jar file.
